column5: Anyone know of any map cards that include Big Canon Lake northwest of Vermilion Bay?

None that I know of. However it is an easy lake to navigate, and the camp owners can you put you on the fish. Lots and lots of fish. Great guide in camp, and a couple of great guides here on WC. Great multi species location.
Didn't see it on any of my cards (Navionics, Garmin Inland, Trak Maps). I do have a PDF depth map if you want me to post it up.
Thanks guys. I've been there, taking a few newbies next June and trying to keep them from getting lost in the wilderness...especially on the river.

Acker. None that I know of with water depth info. but there are some with the topography, islands, etc, that certainly can be used for navigation to find the way back to the landing for dinner! Mine is a Navionics chip. Good luck, as you know the "newbies" will have a great time.
If you have GPS with tracks , drop down a few strategic waypoints for the dock, shore lunch and intersections. You should be good all week.
I think a couple will have a gps so I can make sure they waypoint the docks on the lake and river. Thanks

If its on a Navionics map card it will be on the Web App which contains the same data. After zooming in click on the sonar icon for the Sonar Chart view which will contain more detail https://webapp.navionics.com/?lang=e...y=qqeyH%7Cv_uP
